note: The HND Pharmacy Technician programme is accredited and prepares students for roles in hospital and community pharmacies.
Graduates may work under the supervision of registered pharmacists in various healthcare settings.

mode: In-person lectures with laboratory and clinical practice sessions
Supervised practical training in hospital and community pharmacy settings
entry_requirements: WASSCE: At least credit passes (A1-C6) in English Language, Core Mathematics and Integrated Science
WASSCE: At least credit passes (A1-C6) in three science electives including Biology and Chemistry
Mature applicants: At least 25 years, relevant work experience and successful interview or entrance examination
level_note: The programme combines theoretical pharmacy sciences with supervised practical training.
Students acquire skills in dispensing, drug handling and basic pharmaceutical care.

note: The Faculty of Theology provides Christian higher education with strong emphasis on biblical foundations and ministry formation.
Programmes are suitable for pastors, church workers, missionaries and Christians seeking deeper theological training.

mode: In-person teaching with lectures, seminars and ministry practicums
Blended learning with weekend and evening sessions where applicable
entry_requirements: WASSCE or equivalent with credit passes in at least five subjects including English Language
Credit in Religious Studies or any other related subject plus two additional relevant electives
Holders of Diploma in Theology or related field may be considered for advanced standing subject to interview
level_note: The programme provides grounding in biblical studies, church history, theology and ministry practice.
Students are trained for pastoral and ministry leadership in churches and Christian organisations.

courses.course_name: Masters of Arts in African Christianity

mode: Sandwich mode with intensive 4-week course blocks
Blended learning combining on-campus teaching and guided independent study
entry_requirements: A first degree in any field from a recognised university
A first degree in Theology or Religious Studies is an added advantage
Proof of active ministry and successful admission interview
level_note: The programme focuses on Christianity in the African context, African theologies and church life.
Students develop advanced skills for research, teaching and leadership in African Christianity.

courses.course_name: Masters of Arts in Biblical Studies

mode: Sandwich mode with intensive 4-week course blocks
Blended learning with readings, research and supervised writing
entry_requirements: A first degree from a recognised university, preferably in Theology, Biblical Studies or related field
Proof of ministry or active involvement in Christian service
level_note: The programme offers advanced study in Old Testament, New Testament and biblical interpretation.
Students are prepared for teaching, preaching and scholarly engagement with the biblical text.

courses.course_name: Masters of Arts in Theological Studies

mode: Sandwich mode with intensive 4-week course blocks
Blended learning combining classroom teaching and independent research
entry_requirements: A first degree in any field from a recognised university
Preference for applicants with a first degree in Theology or related field
Proof of ministry and successful interview
level_note: The programme provides broad advanced training in biblical studies, theology, ethics and ministry.
Students are equipped for leadership roles in churches, theological education and Christian organisations.
